metric.originalName: Architecture - Reuse
Programming Practices - Error and Exception Handling
Efficiency - SQL and Data Handling Performance
Secure Coding - API Abuse
Secure Coding - Weak Security Features
Efficiency - Expensive Calls in Loops
Programming Practices - Unexpected Behavior
Avoid using the call of web service $.ajax inside a loop
Avoid using element type in jQuery
Implement success and error or complete callbacks when using jquery web service call before jQuery 3.0
Always use find for Id->Child nested selectors
Always cache the returned objects in variables to be reused
Use "type=" to select elements by type
Avoid use of anonymous functions to attach events
Avoid using css() of many elements
Avoid Universal Selectors
Avoid using jQuery deprecated methods
Avoid using jQuery $.cookie
Avoid using Ajax method without dataType before jQuery 3.0
Avoid using dialog with closeText parameter before jQuery UI 1.12
Always implement done, fail and/or always callbacks for $.ajax calls when using jQuery 3.0 (and latest)
Avoid using html() with jQuery 1.9.0 (or older)
Avoid using jQuery $(location.hash) before 1.6.3
Avoid using .append() after() in jQuery 1.4.2 (or older)
Avoid using attr() with jQuery 3.0.0-rc1
Avoid using Dialog Widget with jQuery UI version older than 1.10.0
Avoid using Tooltip widget with jQuery UI version older than 1.10.0
